title: Near-Field Gain and Far-Field Control via a Plasmonic Time Crystal Slab
summary: This paper studies light-matter interactions in time-varying media, specifically a plasmonic time crystal slab. It explores near-field gain and far-field control through temporal modulation of the plasma frequency, leading to suppressed nonradiative losses and strong radiation at parametric resonance.
usefulness_reason: The abstract explicitly mentions "time varying media" and "temporal modulation," which directly relates to the "Spatio Temporal" aspect of the query. While not a point process, the focus on temporal changes in a spatial medium makes it relevant.
